item.title: Madden NFL 25: 6 Tips & Tricks For Franchise
item.description:
Highlights

  • Have a strong start by picking a team that plays how you want & setting obtainable goals.
  • Don't leave Training Camp with suboptimal stats & build trust with the team.
  • Interact with all notifications items & unlock hidden potential for different player development rates.

With each entry in the Madden NFL series of games, there comes Franchise game mode — each time being a more impressive affair than the previous year. Players of Madden NFL 25 will be able to select their favorite NFL team and build them up with players of varying caliber. Players will be able to progress through the game mode as either a Coach or as an Owner, each with their own approach.

Players shouldn’t think that the best course of action is to just dive into a new season. There is plenty to do in the preseason, and having a well-thought-out game plan can make this game mode a far more enjoyable experience. Players might also want to check out the changes to the other game modes, like Superstar, that NFL 25 has made.

1 Have A Strong Start

Players Should Pick A Team That Plays How They Want

When it comes time to choose the right team that players will be starting their Franchise journey with, they will be able to see each team’s total rating for Overall, Offense, and Defence . The game lets players progress Franchise through either key moments, by playing a full game, playing all the offensive snaps, or controlling all the defensive snaps. Players should pick a team that best caters to how they plan to play. The two teams with the highest Overall are the San Francisco 49ers and the Kansas City Chiefs — both with an Overall of 88 . It’s not just about how good things look in the game, it’s also about the numbers behind the plays.

Players can also see where each team placed in the 2024 NFL Rankings, and what the development will be like at the bottom of Franchise Info. After choosing a team, players will be able to choose if they would prefer to play as a Coach, or as an Owner. By Selecting Change Roles, players will be able to see how each of these roles will affect their Franchise experience before it starts. Finally, players should go through the League Settings to make sure everything is exactly how they want it for the best experience.

2 Don’t Leave Training Camp With Nothing

Players Only Get One Shot, Make It Count

There are numerous minigames to select in the Training Camp at the start of the franchise. This provides players with plenty of points for them to have a great head start heading into the season. Once a player starts one of the minigames, they will be able to earn a medal ranging from Bronze to Gold. Each time one of these minigames comes to an end, players will be able to re-try or leave.

Players should keep at it to try to get the highest reward they can because once they leave the minigame, it will become locked. This means players should never leave without at least getting a Bronze medal, but try to get the best scores they can. Playing these minigames can help players understand many of the game’s new features.

3 Interact With All Notifications Items

Don’t Progress With Suboptimal Stats

Having a top-notch method of knowing what to check on is very important. Lots of games and devices like the PS5 make use of them to help players stay on top of their tasks. Players will see colorful dots next to many of their menu items as they progress through Franchise. This shows that there are upgrade opportunities available.

Failing to acknowledge these can have detrimental results. Players will need to make sure their Staff is being managed, that their characters are being upgraded, and that they are performing all of the game's Storyline elements . This will result in higher stats and more morale.

4 Build Trust With The Team

Strong Bonds Win Games

Speaking of Morale, it is important for the player to keep their athlete’s Morale high . Morale can take a nasty hit when players make the wrong choices during the Franchise Storyline elements , so they will need to be cautious. This is not one of those profound morality systems where players will have an obvious “Good” or “Evil” option. Players will need to react promptly to hard-hitting questions.

This can be by answering an interviewer, or even when one of the players is asking them for advice. Higher morale will provide a boost that can make or break a close match, so players will need to be mindful of the answers they choose. It is best to put oneself in the mindset of what will be best for the players and avoid saying something that could cause conflict among the team.

5 Set Obtainable Goals

Slow & Steady Is A Good Strategy

By going into Manage Team, and then Franchise Staff, players will be able to find their Head Coach, Offensive Coordinator, Defensive Coordinator, and Player Personal . Looking in the top right corner will show the upgrade currency that players can use to purchase Talents within their staff member’s Talent Trees.

To gain this currency, they will need to accomplish Gameday Goals — which will be listed under their Staff Members . Players who set much harder goals will have more to gain but risk not accomplishing these goals at all. Players should set easily obtainable goals to ensure their staff gets more Talents out of games — at least for their first go at Franchise.

6 Unlock Hidden Potential

Different Players Develop At Different Rates

Players will need to coach athletes who will have a wide range of potential development. The most potent players that fans can put in the game will be Superstar X-Factor Players . These players will develop faster than any other players on the roster, and gain access to Zone and Superstar Abilities by accomplishing goals while they play.

However, some will be bottom of the barrel, and others might be hidden completely. When their Development is hidden , players will need to put the player into games to complete a challenge listed underneath it. Once this challenge has been completed, they will be able to see what they are made of — it is highly recommended to complete these challenges.

item.title: Dancing Blade of Ranah Build Guide In Elden Ring: Shadow Of The Erdtree
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Obtain The Dancing Blade of Ranah In Shadow Of The Erdtree
  • Dancing Blade of Ranah Stats & Scaling
  • Best Talismans To Pair With Dancing Blade of Ranah
  • Best Armor To Pair With Dancing Blade of Ranah
  • Best Character Attribute Distribution For Dancing Blade of Ranah
  • Best Wondrous Flask Of Physick Combination For Dancing Blade of Ranah
  • Best Incantations To Pair With Dancing Blade of Ranah
  • Best Great Rune To Pair With Dancing Blade of Ranah
  • Dancing Blade of Ranah Buffing Routine & Attack Strategy

Dancing Blade of Ranah is a Curved Sword in the Elden Ring DLC. This weapon has quite a unique movement compared to other Curved Swords, especially its Weapon Skill, Unending Dance . As the name suggests, this skill can last forever if you have enough FP and Stamina. Players can acquire this weapon early in the Realm of Shadow and not have to fight any boss before it.

This guide includes all the details on where to find the Dancing Blade of Ranah and what Talismans and Incantations work best with it in Shadow of the Erdtree .

How To Obtain The Dancing Blade of Ranah In Shadow Of The Erdtree

The Dancing Blade of Ranah is located on the Cerulean Coast . To reach this location, players can either head south of the Ellac River Cave or go through the Dragon's Pit to reach Charo's Hidden Grave , then take the path west of the Grand Altar of Dragon Communion . Upon reaching the Cerulean Coast West Site of Grace, you can look for a path leading down into a cave that leads to the Southern Nameless Mausoleum. Inside the Mausoleum is the Dancer of Ranah , who drops the weapon once she is defeated.

Dancing Blade of Ranah Stats & Scaling

Scales Primarily With Dexterity

The following are the stat requirements, as well as the scaling on a fully upgraded Dancing Blade of Ranah:

Attribute

Level

Scaling (Max)

Strength

9

-

Dexterity

20

A

The weapon requires 9 Strength to wield but has no scaling with it. This means that players can focus on increasing Dexterity , increasing their overall damage, and casting the speed of Spells. The Dancing Blade of Ranah can be upgraded to +10 using Somber Smithing Stones.

Best Talismans To Pair With Dancing Blade of Ranah

The weapon skill of the Dancing Blade of Ranah consists of successive attacks that you can perform on the enemy. As the skill does not deal enough poise damage, there is a high chance that you might be interrupted while performing it. In most cases, you need to be ready to cancel the skill to perform a dodge. The Rotten Winged Insignia and Millicent's Prosthesis can buff the successive attacks. The Shard of Alexander will increase the skill's damage; meanwhile, the Blue Dancer Charm works wonders if the Dancer Set is equipped.

Talisman

Description

Shard of Alexander

Obtained upon completing Iron Fist, Alexander's questline, the Shard of Alexander increases the damage output of skills/Ash of War by 15%.

Blue Dancer Charm

You can obtain this by defeating Guardian Golem in Highroad Cave in Limgrave. Blue Dancer Charm provides an increase in Physical Damage with lower equip load.

Rotten Winged Sword Insignia

Obtained upon proceeding further into Millicent's questline. Rotten Winged Sword Insignia greatly raises attack power with successive attacks.

Millicent's Prosthesis

You can obtain this upon proceeding further into Millicent's questline; the Millicent Prosthesis increases Dexterity by five and raises attack power with successive attacks.

Best Armor To Pair With Dancing Blade of Ranah

The only option for this build is the Dancer's Set , which also drops from the Dancer of Ranah. Each of the four pieces of the armor set provides a 2.5 % increase in damage to dancing attacks totaling up to 10%. As the Dancing Blade is your only damage-dealing weapon in this build, you can use its weapon skill to truly benefit from the buff the armor provides. The total weight of the Dancer Set is 7.5.

Armor Type

How To Obtain

Dancer's Hood

Obtained after defeating Dancer of Ranah

Dancer's Dress

Obtained after defeating Dancer of Ranah

Dancer's Bracer

Obtained after defeating Dancer of Ranah

Dancer's Trousers

Obtained after defeating Dancer of Ranah

Best Character Attribute Distribution For Dancing Blade of Ranah

Most of your Attribute distribution should be focused on increasing Dexterity , Mind , and Endurance . This is because the build requires a lot of FP and Stamina, which are consumed by the weapon's skill. The weapon only has scaling in Dexterity, so it is wise to put most of your levels into that Attribute. For the rest of the levels, you can hedge to Vigor, but make sure you have at least 25 Faith to be able to use Golden Vow.

If you want to Respec your Attribute levels, you can head to Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon inside Raya Lucaria Academy , and give her a Larval Tear .

The following table shows the Attribute distribution for a 200-level character:

Attribute

Level

Vigor

60

Mind

54

Endurance

50

Strength

12

Dexterity

60

Intelligence

9

Faith

25

Arcane

9

Best Wondrous Flask Of Physick Combination For Dancing Blade of Ranah

For the Wondrous Flask of Physick, the Thorny Cracked Tear is a great option, which, similar to the Talismans, increases the damage of consecutive attacks. The main problem with this build is that you will find yourself relatively weak. This is because of the light armor and no Talismans to help out your defenses. However, you can equip the Opaline Hardtear , which will give a 15% damage negation, which might not be enough but still can help you in many scenarios.

Flask Tear

Description

Opaline Hardtear

Obtained upon killing Putrid Avatar near Fort Faroth in Caelid. The tear increases all damage negation types by 15% for 3 minutes.

Thorny Cracked Tear

Obtained upon killing the Putrid Avatar in Consecrated Snowfields. This tear increases the damage of consecutive attacks and lasts for 3 minutes.

Best Incantations To Pair With Dancing Blade of Ranah

The Armor Set and the Talismans provide a damage boost to the Dancing attacks, meaning equipping an offensive Incantation would not be wise. However, that does not mean you can use the Supportive Incantations, especially those that can be stacked. Golden Vow and Flame, Grant me Strength both increase your damage output as well as your damage negation.

Incantation

Description

Golden Vow

Found on a corpse in the Corpse-Stench Shack on Mt. Gelmir. This Incantation increases your damage output by 15% and negates all damage by 10%. The buff lasts for 80 seconds.

Flame, Grant me Strength

Found behind Fort Gael, guarded by two flame chariots. This Incantation boosts your physical and fire damage output by 20%, and the buff lasts for 30 seconds.

Best Great Rune To Pair With Dancing Blade of Ranah

Great Runes can activated by using Rune Arcs . Players can acquire Rune Arc by helping other online players in their worlds or by looting certain corpses. Malenia's Great Rune is a great option that benefits players who go for an aggressive playstyle. The ability to restore your lost health allows you to fight for a longer duration without worrying about healing yourself.

Great Rune

Description

Malenia's Great Rune

Obtained upon defeating Malenia, Blade of Miquella. This Great Rune allows you to recover lost HP when attacking immediately after getting hit.

Radahn's Great Rune

Obtained upon defeating Starscourge Radahn. This Great Rune boosts your maximum HP, FP, and Stamina.

Dancing Blade of Ranah Buffing Routine & Attack Strategy

Before a boss fights or an online player invades you, it is best to buff yourself beforehand with the Incantations.

  • Consume the Wondrous Flask to increase damage negation and the damage of consecutive attacks.
  • Apply the Golden Vow incantation to boost damage output and negate damage to self.
  • Apply Flame, Grant Me Strength incantation to increase damage output.

The build has relatively low damage negation, meaning that most attacks can take out a massive chunk of your health bar. However, because of how light the Armor Set and weapon weigh, you will have a Light Roll, allowing you to dodge most attacks easily. Even though the weapon skill can go on for a long duration, it is advisable that you cancel the animation as soon as you see an incoming attack.

item.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 Zombies' Terminus Cinematic Raises One Big Question About The Map's Story
item.description:
Highlights

  • Black Ops 6 introduces a new Zombies mode with a prison escape storyline involving Dr. William Peck and newcomer Maya Aguinaldo.
  • Maya's search for her brother, tied to Richtofen's imprisonment, sets up a major plot twist in Black Ops 6's Zombies mode.
  • The identity of Maya's brother could make or break the success of the Terminus story, potentially involving a new character or a returning one.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 is set to launch on October 25, and with this new addition to the Black Ops series comes a fresh Zombies mode, as well. Black Ops 6 recently revealed its first cinematic trailer for Zombies, and a story revolving around a tense prison escape is on the horizon. Dr. William Peck is back and has freed Requiem from their imprisonment in Terminus.

Now free, Grigori Weaver, Oskar Strauss, Elizabeth Grey, Raptor One, and Mac Carver are back in action, but there is also a new face rounding out the Terminus team. Peck isn't alone in his quest to free Requiem and get revenge on Richtofen. He's accompanied by newcomer Maya Aguinaldo, a mysterious Filipina smuggler who is in search of her brother. Although the mention of Maya's brother in the cinematic was brief, it was made clear that the search for this unnamed brother is going to play a major role in the story. Maya's mysterious sibling is being set up as a big reveal, but there are also plenty of questions surrounding who it could be.

Maya's Brother Could Play a Larger Role in Black Ops 6 Zombies' Story

Black Ops Could Introduce a New Character or Be Teasing Something More

Besides the prison break angle, the only other main plot point that is made clear is that all operatives involved have a shared enemy in Richtofen. It's easy to assume that Maya's beef with Richtofen involves her brother's imprisonment, but the reasoning and nature of him being locked up remains unclear. Black Ops 6 's zombies mode is making some bold moves, and its Terminus escape storyline is further proof of this.

Maya's brother could very well be setting up a big reveal at the story's climax. The Terminus team's journey of blasting through hordes of zombies while searching for this unknown brother needs to pay off in a big way if players are going to be wowed by the eventual reveal. If Maya's brother isn't a brand-new character, then the cinematic trailer could be teasing the reveal of a returning character who has been gone for a long time. However, which character that might be raises more questions than answers, as there isn't anyone who would make clear sense.

At the moment, it doesn't seem like it could be another operative, since Maya is the first operative of Filipina heritage to be featured in Zombies. Vanguard 's Isabella Reyes is another Call of Duty character who is Filipina, but considering Vanguard takes place in World War 2, and she's a woman, she doesn't meet the criteria. Black Ops 6 is breaking some traditions in the franchise, and this could ultimately be further done by making Maya's brother an all-new character whose importance is yet to be known.

Black Ops 6 Zombies Potentially Setting Up a New Character

With the options regarding an Easter egg character being really murky, a never-before-seen character may be the most realistic choice for the story to make. Since Maya is a fresh face in the Zombies story, it would only make sense for her brother to be new as well. The biggest issue with this, though, is that her brother will have to play a monumental part in the story in order to feel like a rewarding payoff. His supposed ties to Richtofen will be the key to this character's importance, but only time will tell if Zombies sticks the landing.

On the one hand, a twist that brings a long-gone character back may be the only way to make the hunt for Maya's brother feel worthwhile. If the character is a new role and doesn't get the proper build-up, then the main plot of Zombies could prove to be a disappointment. Black Ops 6 has high expectations from players, and the identity of Maya's brother could potentially make or break the success of Zombies' Terminus story.

item.title: Skyrim: The 22 Best Graphics Mods You Need To Install
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Security Overhaul
  • Simplicity Of Snow
  • Footprints
  • Lux Orbis
  • A Clear Map Of Skyrim And Other Worlds
  • Enhanced Blood Textures
  • Skyrim 202X Parallax
  • Forgotten Retex Project
  • Veydosebrom Regions
  • Cathedral Player And NPC Overhaul
  • JS Dragon Claws AE
  • Realistic Water Two
  • Deadly Spell Impacts
  • Ruins Clutter Improved
  • Enhanced Night Sky
  • Skyland AIO (All-in-One)
  • Static Mesh Improvement Mod
  • Book Covers Skyrim Updated
  • Enhanced Lights & FX
  • Underground 4K-8K - A High-Res Dungeon Texture Overhaul
  • Majestic Mountains
  • Blended Roads

The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim is an amazing game, no doubt about it. However, Skyrim has been out for a decade now, and the graphics have certainly seen better days. Luckily, thousands of mods are currently available to rectify the problem. With a little work, Skyrim has the potential to look stunning with the right mods installed.

These graphics mods serve as an excellent base to get the player started. There exists a literal multitude of graphics mods. In fact, some only deal with the re-texturing of a single object! The mods here provide the broad strokes to get Skyrim to look its very best. More of them can always be added alongside these essential enhancements.

Updated August 14, 2024, by Hamza Haq: Over a dozen years have passed since Skyrim's initial release, yet the modding community continues to breathe new life into the world of Tamriel, making it more vibrant and stunning than ever. The ever-expanding library of mods shows no signs of slowing down, offering countless options to enhance the game. The first step in creating any modlist is upgrading Skyrim's outdated graphics to a more modern standard. With thousands of mods available, the sheer volume can be overwhelming. To help, this list covers the absolute must-haves, ensuring the journey through Skyrim is nothing short of spectacular.

Security Overhaul

Downloads: 2,868,300

  • Created by kreiste-wSkeever-powerofthree
  • Mod Link

Skyrim holds a lot of goodies locked away behind closed doors and tantalizing chests. Even non-stealthy players likely find themselves spending large amounts of time staring at the lockpicking screen to see what loot there is to discover. Unfortunately, every lock in Skyrim appears exactly the same, whether they're encountered in palatial estates or dank caves.

Players who love expanding on the immersion of the game really shouldn't leave home without the Security Overhaul mod. The locks of Skyrim now have a more varied appearance and complement the environment in which they are found. For example, a chest beneath a body of water will have barnacles attached to it. If they haven't already, fans should give this mod a shot.

Simplicity Of Snow

Downloads: 2,571,994

  • Created by wSkeever
  • Mod Link

It should come as no surprise that Skyrim, being a northern province of Tamriel, gets a lot of snow. The wintery conditions that characterize the land of the Nords set the game apart from the ashy, swamp-ridden lands of Vvardenfell and the lush greenery of Cyrodiil. Nevertheless, the quality of the snow from this 2011 game hasn't aged very well.

The title of this mod is apt. Simplicity of Snow is a lightweight mod that can work alongside other snow texture mods for an overall cleaner appearance. Snow will look more natural and less like it was painted onto the environment. Fans who tend to employ large load orders should appreciate the utility of this mod.

Footprints

Downloads: 4,604,346

  • Created by hexabit
  • Mod Link

A good half of Skyrim is covered in snow, and while updating the look and feel of the snow itself with Simplicity of Snow, which is an excellent first measure, players can go a step further with Footprints.

Essentially, what the mod does is convert the flat plane of snow into an interactable environment that reacts to what's happening on top of it. Players trudging through a snowy landscape will leave deep footprints behind them, winter wolves will leave pawprints, and ice trolls will leave their own markers. Built-in Particle FX ensures that the effect is consistent and pretty, blending into the game like it was always a part of it.

Lux Orbis

Downloads: 2,370,522

  • Created by GGUNIT
  • Mod Link

The underwhelming lighting quality of vanilla Skyrim is hard to miss. Ancient dungeons and deep caves aren't all that impressive when it comes to their lighting effects. Interior locations lack realistic shadows despite the familiar presence of candelabras and braziers. Fortunately, players don't lack options when it comes to worthwhile lighting mods.

Lux Orbis is one of Skyrim 's premier lighting mods. Put simply, with this mod, light will conform more to reality. Players will certainly notice the difference while inside an interior. The shadows cast by flames are immediately more apparent. The windows of residences also have a more "lived-in" appearance when viewed from the outside. All of this makes for a highly immersive environment that old and new fans will instantly appreciate.

A Clear Map Of Skyrim And Other Worlds

Downloads: 805,369

  • Created by DoubleYou
  • Mod Link

Players may not realize how much time they spend looking at Skyrim 's world map. The map itself is vital for fast traveling and planning one's future explorations. A Quality World Map had been the go-to mod for many years but is now rather dated.

As such, players may want to check out the A Clear Map of Skyrim and Other Worlds mod. Among a host of other tweaks, this mod adds additional maps for locations such as Blackreach, the Soul Cairn, the Forgotten Vale, and more.

Enhanced Blood Textures

Downloads: 8,235,945

  • Created by dDefinder
  • Mod Link

Skyrim certainly isn't the most violent video game in existence. Nevertheless, enemies can still be dispatched in a variety of rather gruesome ways, including decapitation. The blood isn't overdone and the textures, by this point, fail to impress. Luckily, an awesome mod exists that gives Skyrim 's blood a much-needed update.

The appropriately titled Enhanced Blood Textures adds more visceral realism to the proceedings. Not only does the blood itself look better, but there's also more of it. Players can also customize how much of it they want. An updated playthrough of Skyrim with better textures won't be complete without this mod.

Skyrim 202X Parallax

Downloads: 19,632,179

  • Created by Pfuscher
  • Mod Link

As far as retexture mods are concerned, the Skyrim 2020 Parallax mod by Pfuscher is still relevant in 2022. As an all-in-one package, this mod is a gargantuan texture pack composed of approximately 2,000 files. Fans who want to install everything the mod has to offer can expect several gigabytes worth of content.

However, the results are worth it. Skyrim 's architecture, landscapes, and everything else in between will look sharp and crisp in a way that's hard to forget. The mod is also compatible with others on this list, such as Static Mesh Improvement, Blended Roads, and ELFX.

Forgotten Retex Project

Downloads: 1,913,444

  • Created by JDAnchor
  • Mod Link

It's worth noting that even the largest retexture packs can't cover every object in this massive game. Some of the less important items, such as junk and clutter, are often overlooked. Luckily, fans don't have to hunt down a myriad of individual mods to satisfy their needs for enhanced clutter.

The Forgotten Retex Project is a great mod for improving the more mundane items scattered throughout the world. It's also worth noting, however, that even unique quest items, like the Crown of Barenziah, are given some love as well. From cookware to ancient diadems, this mod is one that surely shouldn't be forgotten.

Veydosebrom Regions

Downloads: 2,337,089

  • Created by Elyem
  • Mod Link

Much of Skyrim 's gameplay is experienced in the outside environment. As such, the foliage must look its best. Veydosebrom Regions is a great choice as it diversifies and sharpens the game's plentiful vegetation. Each region of Skyrim is given its unique feel to it by expanding the variety of flora.

The mod is very lore-friendly in its approach, so nothing should feel unusual for an Elder Scrolls game. When installing, choosing "Standard Quality" is the best choice without making the environment too dense with grass and shrubbery.

Cathedral Player And NPC Overhaul

Downloads: 381,978

  • Created by Soulmancer and Laeris and The Community
  • Mod Link

Skyrim is teeming with NPCs. By now, these NPCs are showing their age. For them, a great choice for an all-in-one graphics mod is Cathedral Player and NPC Overhaul. Fans who don't want the NPCs of Skyrim to look radically different from their vanilla designs should consider this mod in their load orders.

With this mod installed, characters will still look the same way that players remembered them, but with a vast improvement to their face textures, eyes, and hair. As a result, NPCs now possess more originality to them, which fans will be able to notice right off the bat.

JS Dragon Claws AE

Downloads: 1,618,175

  • Created by johnskyrim
  • Mod Link

Fans will inevitably come across dragon claws throughout their playthrough. A variety of claws, which are all made out of precious metals, exist in the game. Although their corresponding puzzles are extremely simplistic, they are at least striking to behold.

JS Dragon Claws AE revamps Skyrim 's dragon claws in a major way. The vanilla textures are replaced with brand-new ones that make these key items pop in a manner that's hard to ignore. Fans can install 1K, 2K, or 4K resolutions of the mod, depending on their setup. The work on this mod is truly impressive, so fans shouldn't ignore it when upgrading Skyrim 's visuals.

Realistic Water Two

Downloads: 8,164,783

  • Created by isoku-TechAngel85-CaptainCockerel
  • Mod Link

The look of the water is one of those details that can sometimes be easy to overlook. But water is plentiful in Skyrim , so it deserves some attention. Arguably the best of the bunch is Realistic Water Two.

This mod adds some much-needed color and vibrancy to bodies of water. Ponds, marshes, streams, and rivers are all given some diversity. New sounds are added as well. Stunning shades of green and blue make the overall landscape pop. Swimming in Skyrim 's rivers and streams never looked so good!

Deadly Spell Impacts

Downloads: 2,862,045

  • Created by isoku
  • Mod Link

Improving the overall look of the characters and environment is important, but what about the more subtle details? More specifically, the impact of spells on their surroundings. The vanilla experience is by now, unsurprisingly, not very impressive.

A very simple, yet notable mod to consider is Deadly Spell Impacts. With this mod, the effects of magical attacks now appear as one would expect. Each element is given its unique texture, along with a few added details, such as snow melting when a fire attack is unleashed. It's an immersive little addition that mages may find interesting.

Ruins Clutter Improved

Downloads: 4,966,018

  • Created by raiserfx
  • Mod Link

Skyrim involves a lot of dungeon-delving. It's fair to say that players will spend much of their time in various ruins and tombs. Ruins Clutter Improved is a rather large texture mod that focuses on the junk items found in dungeons.

Looking at the same ugly objects over and over again can become tiresome. Improved meshes and textures for objects that are seen almost constantly make them easier on the eyes. Combined with other mods on this list, dungeons will look better than ever.

Enhanced Night Sky

Downloads: 689,127

  • Created by Gorgulla
  • Mod Link

If Skyrim is going to look better, then the sky can't be ignored. More specifically, the night sky deserves some attention. The aptly-titled Enhanced Night Sky mod makes stargazing a veritable feast for the eyes.

Stars, as well as nebula, are given high-resolution replacements, the effects of which are quite dazzling. The mod includes some customization presets, although the "Colorful" option is arguably the best choice. Stopping periodically to enjoy the night sky is hard to resist with this mod.

Skyland AIO (All-in-One)

Downloads: 2,266,503

  • Created by Skyking2020
  • Mod Link

One of the hardest things in Skyrim modding is keeping track of what mods do, which textures have been updated, and which ones still need an overhaul. With literally hundreds of mods just for textures alone, it can be a daunting task to keep everything organized.

Skyland AIO solves that problem to an extent by providing players with high quality HD retextures for basically everything in Skyrim in a single downloadable package. And the best part about it is that it creates a base graphical uplift that can be customized down the road. Meaning if players do find another texture mod for a specific aspect of the game like Northern Roads, for example, they can easily overwrite Skyland with the new mod to replace the textures and everything will still work perfectly.

Static Mesh Improvement Mod

Downloads: 11,779,941

  • Created by Brumbek
  • Mod Link

The world depicted in Skyrim is filled with countless objects. Things the player sees all the time can benefit from a visual upgrade. The Static Mesh Improvement Mod, or SMIM as it's popularly known, gives the game's more mundane objects a fresh coat of paint.

According to the mod author, the goal is "to make the Skyrim architecture, clutter, furniture, and landscaping much nicer." The sheer breadth of this mod is impressive. Tens of thousands of improved meshes for various everyday objects are included.

Book Covers Skyrim Updated

Downloads: 103,786

  • Created by VishVadeva - DanielCoffey
  • Mod Link

There's no shortage of reading material when it comes to an Elder Scrolls game. There are hundreds of books, journals, and notes littered across Skyrim . It's no stretch to say that players are likely to bump into a book of some sort every couple of feet. For objects in the game as prolific as books, it's important they also look their best.

One of the best and most impressive mods for this game, hands down, is Book Covers Skyrim Updated. Every book, journal, and note is given a retexture that makes every one of these objects feel like a unique item. The covers on some of these books are so visually impressive, that it's hard not to examine them for a few seconds just to admire the craftsmanship.

Enhanced Lights & FX

Downloads: 6,085,107

  • Created by anamorfus
  • Mod Link

Older games often possess poor lighting effects, especially when compared to today's standards. Lighting, however, plays a critical role in how a game is presented. Enhanced Lights and FX add some realism to Skyrim 's lighting animations and effects.

One of the most noticeable features of this mod is how light shines through windows and underneath doorways. Burning candles will emit smoke. Shadows and reflections are given more detail. All of these things greatly affect the mood of the game. Inns are cozier. Dungeons are darker. It's a mod that seriously improves the atmosphere in both large and small ways.

Underground 4K-8K - A High-Res Dungeon Texture Overhaul

Downloads: 79,719

  • Created by T4GTR34UM3R - XilaMonstrr
  • Mod Link

Dungeons make up a large part of the exploring in Skyrim . Underground 4K-8K - A High-Res Dungeon Texture Overhaul is the more modern successor to the original Underground Dungeon mod by T4GTR34UM3R.

Now, players can enjoy even crisper textures than ever before while exploring Skyrim 's many dungeons. The mod also comes with performance options for PCs that can't quite handle 8K textures. Overall, it's an excellent addition to any player's load order.

Majestic Mountains

Downloads: 5,968,174

  • Created by T4GTR34UM3R
  • Mod Link

The mountains that dot Skyrim 's landscape are certainly majestic. Enter the Majestic Mountains mod, an enhancement that truly brings out their beauty. Mountain textures look less like they were painted on and more like actual rocks, especially when viewed from a distance.

Another cool little detail is the improved look of the moss that adorns certain rocky outcrops. How the lighting is reflected off the sides of the mountain is also reworked, which gives the environment a more natural feel to it. It's a graphics mod that shouldn't be neglected.

Blended Roads

Downloads: 4,763,202

  • Created by T4GTR43UM3R
  • Mod Link

If fans enjoy the Majestic Mountains mod, they'll also love Blended Roads, made by the same author. Similar to the previous mod, Blended Roads makes Skyrim 's thoroughfares less of an afterthought and more of a natural feature of the landscape.

Rocks and cobblestones now actually appear as such. Roads no longer look like low-resolution blobs sinking into the ground. The road and the ground itself appear more natural, akin to something one may see in real life. This mod goes a long way toward making the overall environment feel more immersive.

A Note Concerning ENBs

Graphics mods are all well and good on their own. But making the game really pop requires an ENB, or Enhanced Natural Beauty. ENBs are not graphics mods per se. Rather, they upgrade many of the game's post-processing effects, such as Ambient Occlusion and Anti-Aliasing.

ENBs fit hand-in-glove with graphics mods, making details sharper and colors more vibrant. A player is cheating himself by only having one without the other. A good choice that works well is Natural and Atmospheric Tamriel. This particular ENB gives things a photorealistic quality, which makes the overall environment look awesome when paired with the above mods.

item.title: Future Assassin's Creed Games Could Be Making a Positive Change
item.description: A senior Ubisoft official hints at future Assassin's Creed games making a change that many fans of the series would characterize as positive.
